meanings.definition: The quality or state of being triaxial.
meanings.sent1: The triaxiality of the crystal structure allows it to withstand pressure from all sides.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the triaxiality of materials to understand their mechanical properties.
meanings.sent3: The robot's confusion was due to the triaxiality of its programming, causing it to move in unpredictable ways.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork beautifully captured the triaxiality of nature, with its intricate patterns and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The triaxiality of the star's orbit around the galaxy was a marvel to behold.

meanings.definition: The condition of having three axes or principal directions.
meanings.sent1: The triaxiality of the object made it challenging to determine its orientation in space.
meanings.sent2: The triaxiality of the building's design allowed for maximum stability in high winds.
meanings.sent3: The triaxiality of the compass confused the hiker, pointing in three different directions at once.
meanings.sent4: The triaxiality of the dancer's movements on stage mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The triaxiality of the map provided a comprehensive view of the terrain from multiple angles.
